titleInfo.title: LSU History Oral History Project: Faculty & Adminstrators
titleInfo.subTitle: Fred Bowerman Kniffen oral history interview, 1977

name.description: Professor of geology, Louisiana State University.

subject.topic: Louisiana State University (Baton Rouge, La.).--Dept. of Geology and Geophysics.
Indians of North America--Study and teaching.

mods.note: Louisiana State University Libraries Special Collections (http://www.lib.lsu.edu/special)
mods.accessCondition: Physical rights are retained by the LSU Libraries. Copyright is retained by interviewee and interviewer and/or their heirs in accordance with U.S. copyright laws.

"E-mail lsudiglib@lsu.edu with questions or comments. See instructions for ordering reprints of this audio here: http://www.lib.lsu.edu/special/services/duplication.html Mention the ""Item number"" or ""Item URL"" in your request. "
mods.abstract: Interview discusses Kniffen's education, family life and travels in Michigan, Kansas, California, Washington, Oregon, and Alaska; his work in cultural geography with Native American nations including the Cocopaw, Natchez, Caddo, Avoyelles, and Tensas tribes; his graduate education at the University of California at Berkeley; his move to LSU and his contributions to the development of LSU's geology program; and other aspects of his personal and professional life.
